docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 30 -- Miguel Miranda, former director of Argentine economy, said here today that his health had been "80 per cent" restored and that when his heart was again normal, within a few months, he would be ready to return to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 30 -- Miguel Miranda, former director of Argentine economy, said here today that his health had been "80 per cent" restored and that when his heart was again normal, within a few months, he would be ready to return to Buenos Aires to confront those who, he said, had been "lying" about him.
docs.abstract: M Miranda, in Montevideo, says he is regaining health to confront those 'lying' about him; Pres Peron aid in returning him to pub power seen

headline.main: MIRANDA TO FACE FOES IN ARGENTINA; Ex-Economy Head to Return to Confront Men 'Lying' About Him -- Bid From Peron Seen

headline.main: PERU REPLIES TO ILO AS TO LABOR ATTITUDE

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, April 30 -- The Communist parties of the world now number far more than 20,000,000 members, according to a comprehensive analysis published by S. Ivanov in the journal, Problems of Economics.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, April 30 -- The Communist parties of the world now number far more than 20,000,000 members, according to a comprehensive analysis published by S. Ivanov in the journal, Problems of Economics.

byline.original: By HARRISON E. SALISBURYSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Pound sterling milled about in nervous fashion last week as it reacted to a fresh crop of devaluation rumors which centered in the markets of Tuesday and Wednesday. However, a late-week summation of the sterling situation by the National Foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pound sterling milled about in nervous fashion last week as it reacted to a fresh crop of devaluation rumors which centered in the markets of Tuesday and Wednesday. However, a late-week summation of the sterling situation by the National Foreign Trade Council forced a change in sentiment, once again, followed by an upward recoil in values canceling out earlier losses.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended April 29, 1949

docs.snippet: Dr. Lowrie J. Porter, president of the American Association of Orthodontists, asked the group yesterday to urge Congress to defeat any legislation containing the principle of compulsory health insurance. The association will act on the proposal at a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Lowrie J. Porter, president of the American Association of Orthodontists, asked the group yesterday to urge Congress to defeat any legislation containing the principle of compulsory health insurance. The association will act on the proposal at a business session today.

headline.main: DENTIST ATTACKS HEALTH PROPOSAL; Dr. Porter Asks Association to Vote Against Compulsory Medical Legislation

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, May 5 -- Poland demanded here today that the United Nations General Assembly broaden its two-year policy of diplomatic sanctions against the Franco Government to include a new recommendation to the fifty-eight member countries to cease...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, May 5 -- Poland demanded here today that the United Nations General Assembly broaden its two-year policy of diplomatic sanctions against the Franco Government to include a new recommendation to the fifty-eight member countries to cease all export of arms and strategic materials to Spain.
docs.abstract: Dr Katz-Suchy (Poland) urges UN ban on arms shipments and treaties; US Sen McCarran tells Sec Acheson he will try to cut State Dept budget unless dept eases policy

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 6 -- The pending resolution citing alleged violations of workers' rights in Peru and Venezuela was finally adopted last night by the regional conference here of the International Labor Organization by a vote of 40 to 0, with...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 6 -- The pending resolution citing alleged violations of workers' rights in Peru and Venezuela was finally adopted last night by the regional conference here of the International Labor Organization by a vote of 40 to 0, with three government and two employer delegates abstaining.

headline.main: ILO VOTE REBUKES PERU, VENEZUELA; Montevideo Parley, With Some Abstentions, Adopts Workers' Charges -- Inquiries Likely

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, May 6 -- Seven countries joined today in submitting a joint resolution urging the admission of Israel into the United Nations as a peace-loving state, able and willing to carry out all obligations of the Charter.
